title: Impact of W African institutions- description

content.question: Which of the following best describes the impact of West African cultural institutions such as those found in Timbuktu?

choices.label: Mosques and universities were centers of learning that attracted astronomers, mathematicians, architects, and jurists.
Mosques were the homes of griots, who played an important role in preserving history and cultural practices.
Holy places facilitated the blending of established religions, such as Islam and Christianity, with indigenous spiritual beliefs.
Universities drew economic and political leaders from around the world, developing into centers of diplomacy.

content.answer: Mosques and universities were centers of learning that attracted astronomers, mathematicians, architects, and jurists.

skill.text: 1.A: Identify and explain course concepts, developments, and processes.
